conversation.content: They trusted me. [shaky voice] They trusted my analysis, my models, my... [pause] I keep seeing their faces from the presentation. [very quietly] Mrs. Henderson asked me directly if it was safe. [bitter] I said the fundamentals were solid. I said— [sigh] I mean, the numbers looked right. Everything checked out. The leverage ratios, the cash flows, it all... [confused] How did I miss it? [frustrated] Three decades of retirement savings. Gone. [pause] Just gone. [angry] And corporate's already spinning it as "market volatility" like we didn't know the debt structure was, um... was unsustainable. [regretful] I knew something felt off about those projections. [very sad] But I needed this job. [whispering] I have student loans, rent, I thought I was just being paranoid about the risk assessment. [cry] Eight hundred families. [shaky voice] That's what HR told me this morning. Eight hundred families who can't retire now because I— [long pause] because I wanted to impress the partners. [furious] God, I'm such an idiot! [crying while speaking] My mom's the same age as these people. [very quietly] What if someone did this to her? [hesitantly] I need to... I don't know, maybe I should, um, go public with what really happened? [anxious] They'll destroy me. [determined] But these people deserve to know the truth.
